commit_list.message:
handle None connections when used in a pool

if connection.ensure fails it closes the connection
and removes it before the pool has a chance to
release it

connect to multiple stunnel servers

 * the automagic rewriting of the URL env variables is gone in favor of an explicit `STUNNEL_SERVERS` variable
 * that means that all stunneled *_URL variables need to point to localhost now
need full path to PSK file
donâ€™t change ports, local port and target port can be the same
respect URI path as well (for RDS uris)
letâ€™s not cargo-cult TCP options for now

handle URLs with no username:password part

we donâ€™t actually need it for the stunnel config, the URL parsing
is just very generic

handle non-breaking space chars

this often happens when setting the variable in Heroku dashboard
align patron timeout setting with net_http
commit_list.repo_description: Simple, but flexible HTTP client library, with support for multiple backends.
Simple, but flexible HTTP client library, with support for multiple backends.

commit_list.message:
make it possible to add filters

Filters are configurable checks on occurrences. If
it matches, the exception gets put into an
additional set. These sets make it possible to
filter exceptions on a project level.
